alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 2:31PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF LOS ALAMOS, SOUTHEASTERN RIO ARRIBA, NORTHEASTERN SANDOVAL AND NORTHWESTERN SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM MDT... At 231 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near White Rock, or near Los Alamos, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Los Alamos, Espanola, White Rock, Santa Clara Pueblo, Frijoles, Bandelier National Monument, San Ildefonso Pueblo and El Rancho. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Espanola Valley; Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area
